title: Quiz 24: Infectious Diseases
topicName: NCK Paper 1 Anatomy and Physiology Questions

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, chills, headache, and myalgia after returning from a camping trip. Laboratory tests reveal thrombocytopenia and leukopenia. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
questions.explanation: Camping exposure combined with flu-like symptoms often points to tick-borne illnesses. While thrombocytopenia is classic for Ehrlichiosis/Anaplasmosis, Borrelia (Lyme) is the most common camping-associated pathogen listed here.
questions.hint: Think about tick-borne diseases acquired during camping.

questions.question: A patient presents with foul-smelling diarrhea containing cysts upon microscopic examination. Which of the following parasites is most likely responsible for this infection?
questions.explanation: Giardia lamblia causes steatorrhea (fatty, foul-smelling stool) and is identified by cysts or trophozoites in the stool.

richContent.content:
Giardiasis Key Features:
  • Source: Contaminated water (beavers/campers)
  • Symptoms: Foul-smelling, greasy diarrhea (steatorrhea), bloating
  • Diagnosis: Stool ova & parasites (O&P) showing cysts/trophozoites

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, malaise, and a maculopapular rash that started on the face and spread to the trunk and extremities. Laboratory tests reveal leukopenia and thrombocytopenia. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
questions.explanation: Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever (RMSF) caused by Rickettsia presents with fever, headache, and rash. Thrombocytopenia is a key laboratory finding.
questions.hint: A tick-borne disease causing fever and a rash.

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, headache, myalgia, and a skin lesion resembling a "bull's eye" rash at the site of a tick bite. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
questions.explanation: Erythema migrans (Bull's eye rash) is the pathognomonic sign of Lyme disease, caused by Borrelia burgdorferi.
questions.hint: The rash looks like a target.

richContent.content:
Lyme Disease (Borrelia):
  • Vector: Ixodes Tick
  • Rash: Erythema Migrans (Bull's Eye)
  • Stages: Early (Rash/Flu), Disseminated (Carditis/Bells Palsy), Late (Arthritis)

questions.question: A patient presents with watery diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and nausea after consuming contaminated water from a stream during a camping trip. Laboratory tests reveal oocysts in the stool sample. Which of the following parasites is most likely responsible for this infection?
questions.explanation: Cryptosporidium is a chlorine-resistant parasite often found in recreational water. It is identified by Modified Acid-Fast staining showing oocysts.
questions.hint: Resistant to chlorine and shed as oocysts.

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, chills, headache, and myalgia after returning from a trip to sub-Saharan Africa. Laboratory tests reveal intraerythrocytic ring forms and trophozoites on blood smear examination. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
questions.explanation: Malaria (Plasmodium) is endemic to sub-Saharan Africa. The 'signet ring' form inside red blood cells is diagnostic.
questions.hint: The most common parasitic killer in Africa, affecting red blood cells.

richContent.content:
Malaria Diagnosis:
Thick and thin blood smears show intraerythrocytic ring forms (trophozoites). P. falciparum is the most severe species.

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, headache, and a maculopapular rash that started on the face and spread to the trunk and extremities. Laboratory tests reveal leukopenia and thrombocytopenia. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
questions.explanation: Rickettsial infections often present with fever, headache, and rash.

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, malaise, and a skin lesion resembling a "bull's eye" rash at the site of a tick bite. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
questions.explanation: Repetitive question: Bull's eye rash = Lyme disease (Borrelia).
questions.hint: The rash looks like a target.

questions.question: A patient presents with watery diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and nausea after consuming contaminated water from a stream during a camping trip. Laboratory tests reveal oocysts in the stool sample. Which of the following parasites is most likely responsible for this infection?
questions.explanation: Repetitive question: Oocysts in stool = Cryptosporidium.

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, chills, headache, and myalgia after returning from a trip to sub-Saharan Africa. Laboratory tests reveal intraerythrocytic ring forms and trophozoites on blood smear examination. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
questions.explanation: Repetitive question: Ring forms on smear = Malaria.
